cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles south of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast along the U.S. East Coast, forecast to pass southeast of New England and then head toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast near Cape Fear

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in Massachusetts; watches confined to Mid-Atlantic coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Woods Hole to Sagamore Beach MA and for Nantucket & Martha’s Vineyard MA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic shoreline from Cape Fear NC to southeastern Massachusetts and the offshore waters toward Nova Scotia
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; brief gusts possible Saturday as Dorian passes ~180 mi SE of Boston.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected beyond minor tidal departures; greatest surge threat remains south of Cape Cod.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rainfall to eastern Massachusetts Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents likely along Massachusetts Bay and Cape Cod beaches beginning Friday and persisting through Saturday.
